IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: HARTFORD STAGE COMPANY, INC. IS A NONPROFIT PERFORMING ARTS AND EDUCATION ORGANIZATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF HARTFORD STAGE IS TO ENLIGHTEN, ENTERTAIN, AND EDUCATE BY CREATING THEATRICAL PROGRAMMING OF THE HIGHEST CALIBER THAT HAVE A TRANSFORMATIVE IMPACT ON THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIENCES, THEIR COMMUNITY AND THEIR FIELD.
IRS990.Desc: THEATRICAL PERFORMANCE AND EDUCATION PROGRAM: A TOTAL OF 6 PRODUCTIONSWERE PRODUCED AND PRESENTED AS WELL AS OTHER VARIOUS WORKSHOPS, STAGEDREADINGS AND YEAR-LONG EDUCATION CLASSES/PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THESE FUNDS WERE PAID TO A LOBBYING FIRM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCE AND MANAGEMENT STAFF AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW THE DRAFT. ONCE REVIEWED, THE DRAFT IS SENT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR COMMENT AND APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ANNUALLY. THE STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND KEPT IN THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MANAGING DIRECTOR OR ARTISTIC DIRECTOR MAKES THE COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AFTER REVIEWING THE APPROPRIATE SALARY SURVEY DATA, AMONG OTHER RESOURCES. THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVE COMPENSATION ANNUALLY. THE PROCESS DESCRIBED HERE WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON REQUEST.
